title: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] Cannot open file in another editor if it is already opened (should display warning or error message)
description: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If a file is already opened in one editor, it cannot be opened in another editor. This should display a warning or error message.
OB:
1. Go to the Java Perspective.
2. Open a java file by double clicking on it.
3. The file is opened in the workbench.
4. Right click on the Java file.
5. Select 'Open With .. System Editor'.

Expected: The workbench should display a warning message indicating that there may be changes made to the file and ask if you want to continue, or an error message stating that all files must be closed first.

Note: We believe this is a safety feature where the WSAD (WebSphere Studio Application Developer) does not allow external editing while the file is already opened in WSAD.
SR:
1. Make sure you have an associate Windows editor for your java file. If not, go to the file explorer, double click on any java file, and select WordPad or NotePad as the default editor for all java files.
2. In the Java Perspective, right click on the Java file.
3. Select 'Open With .. System Editor'.

Results: Nothing happens.

Expected: The workbench should display a warning message indicating that there may be changes made to the file and ask if you want to continue, or an error message stating that all files must be closed first.

Note: We believe this is a safety feature where the WSAD does not allow external editing while the file is already opened in WSAD.
